content.raw:
All the physics tests and the regression passed just fine in my box.

In order to test the links, I just launched gazebo with simbody support and create a PR2. Insert a cube that touches the PR2 arms but the whole thing is frozen. I was able to reproduce with from the 3.0 branch so it is not related to this PR. I will create and issue for tracking this.
content.html:
All the physics tests and the regression passed just fine in my box.

In order to test the links, I just launched gazebo with simbody support and create a PR2. Insert a cube that touches the PR2 arms but the whole thing is frozen. I was able to reproduce with from the 3.0 branch so it is not related to this PR. I will create and issue for tracking this.

content.raw:
I moved some of the expectations around since parts of the test are aborted early, and found that GetAxisFrameOffset is failing when the child link is the world. (see b37819474512).
~~~
[Dbg] [494_joint_axis_frame.cc:82] SpawnJoint revolute world parent
[Dbg] [494_joint_axis_frame.cc:107] test case with joint axis specified in parent model frame.
[Dbg] [494_joint_axis_frame.cc:119]   where parent is another link (not world).
[Err] [Joint.cc:991] Joint has no child link.
/home/scpeters/ws/gazebo/src/gazebo/test/regression/494_joint_axis_frame.cc:180: Failure
Value of: axisJointFrame2
  Actual: 0.999035 0.043924 0
Expected: axisJointFrame
Which is: 1 0 0
~~~
content.html:
I moved some of the expectations around since parts of the test are aborted early, and found that GetAxisFrameOffset is failing when the child link is the world. (see b37819474512).

[Dbg] [494_joint_axis_frame.cc:82] SpawnJoint revolute world parent
[Dbg] [494_joint_axis_frame.cc:107] test case with joint axis specified in parent model frame.
[Dbg] [494_joint_axis_frame.cc:119]   where parent is another link (not world).
[Err] [Joint.cc:991] Joint has no child link.
/home/scpeters/ws/gazebo/src/gazebo/test/regression/494_joint_axis_frame.cc:180: Failure
Value of: axisJointFrame2
  Actual: 0.999035 0.043924 0
Expected: axisJointFrame
Which is: 1 0 0

content.raw: What if the child and parent links are from different models? You need to check the parent model frame, not the child model frame.
content.html: What if the child and parent links are from different models? You need to check the parent model frame, not the child model frame.

pullrequest.title: address issue #494 and issue #1143 for simbody

content.raw: The logic behind this was: joint frame is offset from child link frame by `this->anchorPose`, and child link frame is offset from model frame by `this->childLink->GetRelativePose()`.  So adding them and taking the inverse gives us the transform from joint frame to the model frame, where model frame is where `axis` is defined when `axisParentModelFrame` is true.  Please double check my transform algebra :)
content.html: The logic behind this was: joint frame is offset from child link frame by this->anchorPose, and child link frame is offset from model frame by this->childLink->GetRelativePose(). So adding them and taking the inverse gives us the transform from joint frame to the model frame, where model frame is where axis is defined when axisParentModelFrame is true. Please double check my transform algebra :)
